summary: This bill, HR 3766, aims to prevent the District of Columbia from mandating that its tribunals defer to the Mayor's interpretation of statutes and regulations in court or administrative proceedings. It specifically prohibits tribunals from deferring to the Mayor or agency interpretations when reviewing orders, decisions, or rules. Furthermore, it repeals the "Review of Agency Action Clarification Temporary Amendment Act of 2024 (D.C. Law 25–290)" and restores/revives provisions amended/repealed by that Act.
